title.narrative: SWE-2010-165 Understanding Subsistence Agriculture - in search of social innovations for food security
SWE-2010-165 Understanding Subsistence Agriculture - in search of social innovations for food security

description.narrative: Food security is becoming a global emergency due to increasing demands and declining capacity for food production. A large potential for meeting the demands is in agricultural systems where the actual production is much below the optimal, here called the yield gap. The research is guided by three questions: how can sub-Saharan subsistence farmers fill the yield gap in food production for the sake of local food security while contributing to global food security; to what extent is the gendered organisation and management of labour and land in subsistence farming a constraining or enabling factor for filling the yield gap; how can social innovations help subsistence farmers engage with institutional and infrastructural opportunities? The project is a qualitative intensive study capturing the temporal and local particularities in the Lake Victoria Basin.
